sen.j: 棗（なつめ）は茶器の一種で、抹茶を入れるのに用いる木製漆塗りの蓋物容器である。
sen.e: Natsume is a kind of tea utensils and a lacquered wooden decoration container with a lid used to hold powdered green tea.

sen.j: 植物のナツメの実に形が似ていることから、その名が付いたとされる。
sen.e: The name, "natsume," is said to come from the natsume or jujube fruit, which some this container natsume are said to resemble.

sen.j: 現在では抹茶を入れる陶器製の茶入（濃茶器）に対して、抹茶を入れる塗物の器を薄茶器（薄器）と呼ぶが、棗がこの薄茶器の総称として用いられてしまう場合も多い（その歴史に関しては薄茶器の項目を参照）。
sen.e: Today, an earthenware chaire (tea container) for powdered green tea is called koicha-ki (tea utensil for thick tea) while a lacquer ware chaire is called usucha-ki (tea utensil for light tea), but natsume is often used as the generic name for a container for usucha (See the item for usucha-ki for its history).

sen.j: 棗は珠光に塗師の羽田五郎が納めたものが最初とされるが、研究者からは疑問視されている。
sen.e: Natsume is said to have originated from the one that Goro HANEDA, a nurishi (a maker of lacquer ware and handiworks), presented to Juko, though this theory is questioned by researchers.

sen.j: 藤田美術館他に羽田五郎作の伝来を持つ古様の棗が数点現存しているものの、史料による裏付を持たないためである。
sen.e: This is because it has no support documents even though several old natsumes have been preserved in Fujita Museum of Art and other museums and they are said to have been made by Goro HANEDA.

sen.e: This is because there is no historical document to support this, even though several old natsumes that are said to have been made by Goro HANEDA can be found in the Fujita Museum of Art and others.

sen.j: また武野紹鴎好みとする棗も現存しているが、同様に疑問視されている。
sen.e: There is also left the natsume that Joo TAKENO loved but this is also questioned by researchers.

sen.j: それよりも『隔蓂記』の寛永20年（1643年）の記述に梅の花が棗に入れられているという記述があり、これは江戸時代初期までは棗が茶器に限らず用いられていた証左とされている。
sen.e: Contrarily, in "Kakumeiki" (The Diary of Josho HORIN) in 1643, there was a description that branches of plum blossoms were arranged in a natsume, which is said to show an evidence that natsume was also used for other than a tea utensil until the early Edo Period.

sen.j: またこの説により、元禄時代の茶書『源流茶話』（藪内紹智）に記載されている棗が茶入の挽屋を転用したものであるという記述も信憑性を失っている。
sen.e: Based on this theory, the description that the natsume appeared in the Tea book "Genryu Chawa" (tea book written by Chikushin YABUNOUCHI) in the Genroku Era was diverted from a wooden hikiya canister owned by chajin (master of the tea ceremony) has also lost its credibility.

sen.cmt: the Tea→a tea,Era→period,diverted→derived, was→as と修正し、カンマを補いました。

sen.j: これらを踏まえて内田篤呉氏は、棗も茶器の薬籠（ヤロウ）などと同様に、薬などを入れていた漆塗りの器の一種から転用されたものであろうという推測をしている。
sen.e: Based on these, Tokugo UCHIDA speculates that natsume may be diverted from a kind of lacquered containers for medicine as well as a "yaro" tea caddy.
sen.cmt: 原文が、「茶器の茶器（ヤロウ）」となっていますが、薬籠の誤りとして訳しています。

sen.j: 確実な記録としては、『天王寺屋茶会記』の永禄7年（1564）8月20日の津田宗達の茶会で用いられたのが初例であり、他の木製の茶器（薄茶器参照）よりも随分と下っていることが判明している。
sen.e: One reliable record was the one found in "Record of the Tea Ceremony at Tennojiya" that recorded the chakai (tea party) held by Sotatsu TSUDA on august 20, 1564, and it is known that this was the first time a natsume was used as a tea utensil, much later than other wooden cha-ki (See the item for usucha-ki).

One reliable record was the one found in "Record of the Tea Ceremony at Tennojiya," that recorded a chakai (tea party) held by Sotatsu TSUDA in October 5, 1564, and it is known that this was the first time a natsume was used as a tea utensil, much later than other wooden cha-ki (See the item for usucha-ki.)

sen.j: この後千利休好みとされる棗が利休系統の茶人の間で用いられるようになり、江戸時代には薄茶器として一般化する。
sen.e: After that, natsumes of SEN no Rikyu type were started to be used among chajin of Rikyu school and they became popular as a tea utensil in the Edo Period.

sen.j: 本来は黒漆塗りのシンプルなものであり、その非装飾的な造形からは見所により「名物」として優劣をつけられていた茶入を尊んだ既存の茶の湯への抵抗を読み取ることが出来る。
sen.e: Originally, natsume was finished in plain black lacquer and, from its non-decorative design, we can read some backlash against the existing Chanoyu (the tea ceremony) that valued "excellent" chaire based on the judgment from kensho (guest seating).

sen.j: また形は利休型とされる大棗・中棗・小棗が基本形となっているが、多くのバリエーションを持つ。
sen.e: The basic type is the "Rikyū shape" (Rikyū-gata) which are a large "natsume" canister, a medium "natsume" canister, and a small "natsume" canister, but there are many other variations, too.

sen.j: しかし次第に茶入と同時に用いられるようになることで、書院飾りに適した豪華な蒔絵が施されるようになった（室町時代とされる蒔絵の棗も現存しているが、これは本来は茶器ではなかった可能性を想定する必要がある）。
sen.e: However, as natsume gradually became to be used as a chaire, they became to have gorgeous makie (Japanese lacquer sprinkled with gold or silver powder) decoration suited for shoin kazari (decoration of shoin (one of Japan's most important residential architectural styles, established in Momoyama era) rooms and buildings) (The natsume with makie decoration considered to be made in the Muromachi Period has been preserved but this needs to assume the possibility that originally it was not used as a tea utensil).
